definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The rivet heads are in good condition and without abrasion.
sentences.chinese: 铆钉钉头状况良好，并无过度磨损。

sentences.english: Skill levels are from very easy to real knuckle busters .
sentences.chinese: 技能水准是从非常容易对真正的指关节钉头切断机。

sentences.english: It may even be possible to make computers the size of a pinhead one day.
sentences.chinese: 甚至有一天计算机都可能做成钉头那样大小。

sentences.english: These soldiers are equipped with a mace and shield and wear heavy mail armour for protection.
sentences.chinese: 这些战士装备钉头锤和盾并且穿著板甲。

sentences.english: A bright medallion, stitch accents and nail heads create visual appeal.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的徽章，缝的口音和钉头创造视觉上的吸引力。

sentences.english: In that case i am use following method to decrease the nail head.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，我使用下面的方法，以缩短钉头。

sentences.english: Therefore it is clear that research on the technology of pin tube automatic welding is of great significance.
sentences.chinese: 因此研究钉头管自动焊接技术具有十分重要的意义。

definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
a saw/to cut with a saw
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
mortise (slot cut into wood to receive a tenon)
